fields.name: William
fields.bio: William Shakespeare was an English playwright, poet and actor. He is widely regarded as the greatest writer in the English language

fields.name: Elchin Mammadov
fields.bio: Forester and ecologist dedicated to forest conservation. Since 2017, he has led the Shirvan forestry, focusing on sustainable forest management and public education.

fields.title: About articles
fields.content: A news article discusses current or recent news of either general interest (i.e. daily newspapers) or of a specific topic (i.e. political or trade news magazines, club newsletters or technology news websites).

fields.title: Forest Ecology of Azerbaijan: Current Status and Conservation Efforts
fields.content: The forests of Azerbaijan cover 1,213.7 thousand hectares, accounting for 11.8% of the country's total area (86.6 million hectares). The main forest areas are concentrated in the regions of the Greater and Lesser Caucasus, as well as in the Talysh zone. These forests play a crucial role in maintaining the ecosystem by ensuring the stability of water, air, and soil.
